alternative_parents.description: Flavonoids that bear one hydroxyl group at the C-3' position of the flavonoid skeleton.
alternative_parents.name: 3'-hydroxyflavonoids

alternative_parents.description: Flavonoids that bear one hydroxyl group at the C-5 position of the flavonoid skeleton.
alternative_parents.name: 5-hydroxyflavonoids

alternative_parents.description: Flavonoids that bear one hydroxyl group at the C-7 position of the flavonoid skeleton.
alternative_parents.name: 7-hydroxyflavonoids

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a flavan-3-one moiety, with a structure characterized by a 2-phenyl-3,4-dihydro-2H-1-benzopyran bearing a ketone at the carbon C3.
alternative_parents.name: Flavanones

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a methoxy group attached to the benzene ring of a phenol moiety.
alternative_parents.name: Methoxyphenols

alternative_parents.description: Organic aromatic compounds containing a monocyclic benzene moiety carrying exactly or one more methoxy groups.
alternative_parents.name: Methoxybenzenes

alternative_parents.description: Ketones have the generic structure RC(=O)R', where R = aryl group and R'=alkyl group.
alternative_parents.name: Aryl alkyl ketones

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a methoxybenzene or a derivative thereof.
alternative_parents.name: Anisoles

alternative_parents.description: Aromatic compounds contaning a phenoxy group.
alternative_parents.name: Phenoxy compounds

alternative_parents.description: Phenols that a unsubstituted at the 2-position.
alternative_parents.name: 1-hydroxy-2-unsubstituted benzenoids

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing the alkyl aryl ether functional group with the generic formula R-O-R' , where R is an alkyl group and R' is an aryl group.
alternative_parents.name: Alkyl aryl ethers

alternative_parents.description: Phenols that are unsubstituted at the 4-position.
alternative_parents.name: 1-hydroxy-4-unsubstituted benzenoids

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a hydroxyl group, which is indirectly attached to a carbonyl via an intervening vinyl (>C=C<) moiety.
alternative_parents.name: Vinylogous acids

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an heterocycle with at least one oxygen atom linked to a ring carbon.
alternative_parents.name: Oxacyclic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an oxide group.
alternative_parents.name: Organic oxides

class.description: Plant secondary metabolites that contain the 2-phenylchromene skeleton. Plant secondary metabolites that contain the 2-phenylchromene skeleton.
class.name: Flavonoids

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as 4'-o-methylated flavonoids. These are flavonoids with methoxy groups attached to the C4' atom of the flavonoid backbone.

direct_parent.description: Flavonoids with methoxy groups attached to the C4' atom of the flavonoid backbone.
direct_parent.name: 4'-O-methylated flavonoids

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

subclass.description: Flavonoids with methoxy groups conjugated to the flavonoid backbone.
subclass.name: O-methylated flavonoids

superclass.description: Organic compounds that are synthesized either from the amino acid phenylalanine (phenylpropanoids) or the decarboxylative condensation of malonyl-CoA (polyketides). Phenylpropanoids are aromatic compounds based on the phenylpropane skeleton. Polyketides usually consist of alternating carbonyl and methylene groups (beta-polyketones), biogenetically derived from repeated condensation of acetyl coenzyme A (via malonyl coenzyme A), and usually the compounds derived from them by further condensations.
superclass.name: Phenylpropanoids and polyketides
